physical_appearance: This is a black-and-white photograph. It is rectangular in shape and portrait in orientation. It features a man in a swimming pool. The man is leaning out by the edge of the pool. The foreground of the photograph shows a checked tiling. In the background, there are several other people seen lounging by the pool. The photograph is quite faded, especially around the edges. There are no inscriptions on the photograph. There are no tears or folds seen.
sgcool_label_text: This is a personal photograph album that belonged to a Corporal A. Silver who spent 16 months in Singapore between 1951 and 1952. Silver was presumably a Jewish lady who was stationed in Singapore to serve at the Royal Air Force (RAF) Hospital at Changi. The album contains photographs that document her working and personal life, including friends she made within the Jewish community in Singapore.
title_text: "Personal photograph album titled ""Sixteen Months in Singapore""" Sixteen Months in Singapore: Photograph of man in swimming pool
